abstract: Babies raised in bilingual or non-English-speaking households in largely English-speaking territory think differently.
snippet: Babies raised in bilingual or non-English-speaking households in largely English-speaking territory think differently.
lead_paragraph: Babies raised in bilingual or non-English-speaking households in largely English-speaking territory think differently. Perri Klass has a fascinating article in today's New York Times on exactly how differently: they take longer to distinguish phonetic sounds in either language, but then hear them in both; they retain an interest in other languages longer; and as their languages develop, so do strong multitasking and problem-solving skills.
